tasks.name: 0.1 Create Coding Standards Document
tasks.description: Create a coding standards reference document for the Blazor UI migration. Document SOLID principles application, functional programming patterns, complexity limits, and code-behind requirements.
tasks.summary: Created comprehensive coding standards document at docs/blazor-coding-standards.md covering: SOLID principles with Blazor-specific examples, functional programming patterns (immutability, pure functions, expressions), cyclomatic complexity limits (max 5-6) with refactoring techniques, mandatory code-behind pattern, static method requirements, and additional guidelines for async/await, nullable types, and naming conventions.
tasks.analysisResult:
**CODING STANDARDS (Apply to ALL tasks):**

1. **SOLID Principles** - Single Responsibility, Open/Closed, Liskov Substitution, Interface Segregation, Dependency Inversion
2. **Functional Programming** - Favor immutability, pure functions, avoid mutable state. Use records, ImmutableArray, readonly properties
3. **Cyclomatic Complexity** - No method exceeds 5-6. Extract complex logic into smaller private methods or separate classes
4. **Code-Behind Pattern** - All Blazor components use .razor.cs code-behind files. No @code blocks in .razor files. Razor files contain only markup
5. **Static Methods** - Methods not accessing instance state MUST be static

**Architecture:** Blazor Server UI migration with MudBlazor. WebApplicationBuilder replaces EmptyApplicationBuilder. Conditional UI via TASK_MANAGER_UI env var.
tasks.implementationGuide:
1. Create docs/blazor-coding-standards.md
2. Document: SOLID examples for Blazor (SRP=one component per concern, DIP=inject interfaces)
3. Functional patterns: records for DTOs, ImmutableArray for collections, pure static methods
4. Complexity rule: max 5-6 cyclomatic complexity, use guard clauses, extract methods
5. Code-behind: ComponentName.razor (markup only) + ComponentName.razor.cs (partial class with logic)
6. Include code examples for each pattern
tasks.verificationCriteria: Document created with clear examples. Team can reference for consistent implementation.
